sn35.73:1.1: “Mendicants, anyone who doesn’t truly understand the six fields of contacts’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape
sn35.73:1.2: has not completed the spiritual journey and is far from this teaching and training.”
sn35.73:2.1: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha,
sn35.73:2.3: For I don’t truly understand the six fields of contacts’ origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape.”
sn35.73:3.2: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.73:5.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.73:7.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.73:7.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.73:11.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.73:13.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.73:13.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.73:15.1: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.
sn35.73:15.2: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
sn35.73:15.3: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
